title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <Iaks> Ok, sorry for yet another question, but I'm not finding this one in the docs. If I want to have unique dashboard views for each space how can I split them out? I seem to be unable to get them setup any way except for with all dashboards pointing to one configuration  
00:03 <Iaks> ahh - apparently just can't edit the main page dashboard - all others can be edited individually  
00:03 <Iaks> or dashboard  
00:04 <+sburjan`> Iaks: there is a default template dashboard when you create a space  
00:04 <+sburjan`> basically you have 2 options: create a space with a blank WebHome, or create a space using a pre-defined template for the space WebHome  
00:04 <Iaks> right - what I am running into is that when I try to customize how the 'dashboard' or 'main' space looks when I first the load the space  
00:05 <Iaks> and editing either of those changes the template for all other spaces  
00:05 <+sburjan`> yes  
00:05 <+sburjan`> you have to customize the dashboard for each space individually  
00:06 <+sburjan`> or modify the template which is used when creating a new space  
00:06 <+sburjan`> don't know if this answers your question  
00:07 <Iaks> I think that part is clear to me. My question then is can you edit the webhome view for 'dashboard' or 'main' without effecting all other spaces?  
00:08 <+sburjan`> well each space has its own dashboard, so you should be able to edit the dashboard of a space without affecting the otherdashboards  
00:10 <Iaks> hrm - 'dashboard' and 'main' seem to be linked for me =( If I could hide one it would work fine, they are just redundant at this stage of my configuration  
00:10 <+sburjan`> not sure what do you mean by 'dashboard' and 'main'  
00:11 <Iaks> I installed the default .xar config file which configures a bunch of spaces. Two of them are titled 'Dashboard' and 'Main'  
00:11 <Iaks> They seem to lead to the same data  
00:12 <Iaks> but both spaces contain macros and a few other docs that break things when I delete them or change the view permissions  
00:12 <+sburjan`> Main is basically the Main space, when you go to you wiki .. is the /xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome of your wiki  
00:12 <+sburjan`> \*your  
00:13 <+sburjan`> and Main/WebHome uses the dashboard from Dashboard space  
00:13 <+sburjan`> it includes it  
00:13 <Iaks> right - that makes sense. for some reason I have a space called dashboard as well  
00:13 <+sburjan`> so deleting the Dashboard space will remove your dashboard from Main too  
00:14 <Iaks> right - do I need to have both visible to users, though?  
00:14 <Iaks> the dashboard space seems like it is really just storing configuration files and shouldn't be an exposed view  
00:14 <+sburjan`> you mean setting rights on Dashboard space to make it disappear from the spaces list ?  
00:15 <Iaks> I tried that, but then users can't load the dashboard scripts  
00:15 <+sburjan`> yes  
00:15 <+sburjan`> we have a feature which is about excluding technical spaces  
00:15 <+sburjan`> not sure Dashboard is considered technical, but yes, you areright, having a dashboard space might be confusing for end users  
00:16 <+sburjan`> at least having it visible in the spaces macro which displays all spaces  
00:16 <Iaks> Thank you for disentangling my confusing description  
00:16 <Iaks> yes -that is exactly what I'm running into  
00:16 <Iaks> Spaces macro lists two items that I can't delete and both show the identical view/data  
00:17 <+sburjan`> well they are not 100% identical. Basically Main=Dashboard + some text  
00:17 <Iaks> Right - I did delete the welcome text =)  
00:18 <+sburjan`> but if you take it like this, Sandbox should also be hidden, because I don;t think you use it  
00:18 <Iaks> =) yep, that one is susceptible to the rights trick to hide it  
00:18 <Iaks> doesn't break anything else  
00:19 <Iaks> \*so far\*  
00:20 <ssavi> has quit  
00:21 <+sburjan`> also Panels doesn't need to be there  
00:21 <+sburjan`> Xwiki either, because XWiki is crucial if you want to have your wiki working  
00:21 <+sburjan`> so for the moment, maybe you should just stop using the spaces macro in the dashboard, and manually list the spaces you want  
00:22 <Iaks> that sounds like a good work around - I had removed those last two by removing the view right on them for non-admins  
00:22 <Iaks> I don't really need to be able to dynamically add spaces so this could be fine  
00:23 <+sburjan`> because existing spacesw have alreadya purpose, listing them doesn't do any good if you want your users to see only what you want them to see  
00:23 <+sburjan`> ColorThemes is also useless for your users  
00:24 <+sburjan`> in the future some of these spaces will be hidden by default because they contain code which is used by other stuff  
00:24 <Iaks> yep - I basically went down the list of all spaces and prohibited view access, but you are right that a better solution is to build the list manually instead  
00:25 <+sburjan`> seems you wanna build a strict environment for your users :)  
00:27 <Iaks> haha - corporate intranets... what can I say  
00:29 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
00:31 <+sburjan`> yeah, safest way is to drop the spaces macro  
00:31 <+sburjan`> the default dashboard you see is usually for starting with xwiki, this is why it has so many things exposed  
01:04 <Iaks> Haha - well the downside to hiding all those spaces via the rights admin panel is that lots of stuff is boinked now! =( wyswyg doesn't exist, and i'm sure other things too  
01:06 <+sburjan`> hiding them using rights is not the right way for sure  
01:07 <+sburjan`> Stick with my solution, or if you really want to do it another way, try modifying the spaces macro code :)  
01:08 <Iaks> haha yep - I was going to your solution, but had already messed with things =)  
01:08 <Iaks> hrm - I need a hard reset option =)  
01:09 <+sburjan`> rollback the history of pages you modified, undelete pages,etc  
01:09 <+sburjan`> or a hard reset might be re-importing the XAR. this would undone everything ...  
01:09 <+sburjan`> not sure about the rights ..  
01:10 <Iaks> just did that, but the access permissions don't seem to have changed  
01:11 <Iaks> need to uncheck 'import as backup package' maybe  
01:11 <+sburjan`> yes, try that  
01:12 <Iaks> haha - access not allowed to /view/Main  
01:12 <+sburjan`> lol  
01:13 <+sburjan`> I guess you'll have to start over with your xwiki  
01:13 <+sburjan`> :D  
01:13 <+sburjan`> well you might enable superadmin and revive it  
01:13 <+sburjan`> but that might be harder than to start from scratch.. depends how far you've gone  
01:13 <Iaks> haha yep - I'd rahter just wipe and start over  
01:15 <Iaks> I guess I just drop the entire db table and that wipes everything?  
01:15 <+sburjan`> yes  
01:15 <+sburjan`> and re-create the database and grant privileges  
01:15 <+sburjan`> then xwiki will create its schema upon start  
01:15 <Iaks> ahh subtlety  
01:16 <+sburjan`> anyway, if you want to use xwiki in production, it is recommended you perform regulat backups of the db  
01:16 <+sburjan`> I guess this should apply everywhere :)  
01:16 <Iaks> definitely - going to worry about getting a working setup first though =)  
01:24 <Iaks> ahhh - fresh and clean  
01:47 <Iaks> has quit

10:57 <vmassol1> AndreasJonsson: hi  
11:01 <+AndreasJonsson> vmassol1: hi  
11:01 <vmassol1> AndreasJonsson: I think you broke the build :)  
11:01 <vmassol1> for the security modue  
11:01 <vmassol1> try removing the artifacts in your local repo and try rebuilding you should get this;  
11:01 <vmassol1> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-platform-security-bridge: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-security-bridge:jar:4.0-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-security-api:jar:tests:4.0-SNAPSHOT in xwiki-snapshots (http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots) -> [Help 1]  
11:02 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:02 <+AndreasJonsson> Maybe the class includes in the pom were significant after all. :)  
11:03 <+AndreasJonsson> I'll fix it.  
11:03 <vmassol> ok thx  
11:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <+AndreasJonsson> vmassol: I think that the problem was there even before my commit.  xwiki-platform-security-bridge dependes on the test-jar of xwiki-platform-security-api, and snapshot releases of test jars are not available from the maven repository.  
11:31 <vmassol> can you fix it?  
11:31 <+AndreasJonsson> I can remove the old test case that has the dependency.  I will rewrite it later anyway.  
11:34 <+AndreasJonsson> I see that Denis have already written new tests that covers that particular class, so there is no reason to keep the old test.  
11:50 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

14:12 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r99489fb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/99489fb94f52ac80333c0fd63575e496074423e6 / (5 files in 5 dirs): XEM-214: Align and rationalize Build profiles - http://git.io/Gl8kOQ

14:26 <vmassol> I think you're forgetting to run with —rebase when you pull  
14:26 <vmassol> (see your last commit for example)  
14:27 <vmassol> this is creating a lot of unnecessary branches and makes the history not very nice  
14:28 <vmassol> you can see that here for example: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/network

18:46 <@sdumitriu> One note about --rebase, don't use it once a branch is published on github  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> Otherwise all the commits on that branch will be recreated  
18:54 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: If we were to rewrite the FileUploadPlugin as a component, do you think we should expose FileItem from commons-fileupload, like the plugin does, or use our own interface in case we want to move away from commons-fileupload in the future?  
18:54 <@sdumitriu> As a sidenote, when we'll move to servlets 3.0 we might not need commons-fileupload, since the new ServletRequest has a getParts method that exposes the uploaded files  
19:09 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
19:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can't really answer, I'd need to look at the code, i don't know this part  
19:11 <vmassol> I guess it also depends how complex is FileItem  
19:12 <vmassol> if it's simple we cna have our own  
19:12 <vmassol> if it's complex with lots of methods it might not be worth it  
19:12 <vmassol> (depends how much of it we use too)  
19:14 <vmassol> I'm working on http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XCOMMONS-145 ATM  
19:23 <@sdumitriu> I think that having our own interface is better  
19:23 <@sdumitriu> FileItem looks too big for what we need  
19:24 <vmassol> ok  
19:24 <abusenius> has quit  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> Another question: where should we put new filters? xwiki servlet container module?  
19:24 <vmassol> servlet filters?  
19:25 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
19:25 <vmassol> hmm yes I think so  
19:25 <@sdumitriu> Or in their own module?  
19:25 <vmassol> possibly in a sunmodule  
19:25 <vmassol> submodule  
19:25 <vmassol> or if there's a domain  
19:25 <vmassol> that exists  
19:25 <vmassol> in that domain with a submodule with "servlet" in the name  
19:25 <@sdumitriu> OK, sounds good  
19:26 <@sdumitriu> XCOMMONS-145 sounds nice  
19:26 <vmassol> was sure you'd like it ;)  
19:27 <vmassol> I'm close …. writing integration ests  
19:27 <vmassol> using a new technique I'm learning for testing maven plugins  
19:53 <+sburjan`> this check will be made for all xar's we created as vanilla ?

21:42 <vmassol> again  
21:42 <vmassol> I hate that  
21:42 <vmassol> I guess I can delete, push and add back?

21:43 <vmassol> (might break history though - or not)  
21:43 <vmassol> if you can that would be nice  
21:43 <vmassol> :)  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> So, UnXARMojo is the correct name, right?  
21:43 <vmassol> correct  
21:44 <vmassol> I guess there's the same issue with XARMojo too  
21:44 <vmassol> and AbstractXARMojo  
21:44 <vmassol> and the test too  
21:44 <vmassol> XARMojoTest  
21:44 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
21:44 <vmassol> I hope I'll be able to merge this back....

21:45 <vmassol> locally

21:45 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yep but they're excluded in the checkstyle config  
21:45 <vmassol> (haven't changed nor fixed that yet)  
21:46 <@sdumitriu> AbstractXARMojo isn't "public", should it be?  
21:46 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hmm maybe it's enough to wait till I commit my next refactoring  
21:46 <vmassol> I'm just having an extra hard time on some maven related thingie  
21:47 <vmassol> (which I don't understand)  
21:47 <vmassol> I can probably cheat for the time being - I have an idea for that

22:29 <vmassol> not unless they have generics  
22:29 <vmassol> in which case you need to be careful for backward compat
